column4: so is there any other way to install Adobe Flashplayer so that it might work?
Adobe Flashplayer problems, anyone?
no one?
sudo apt-get install flashplugin-installer is all you need
I don't know even know what that means
it should say things such as downloading flashplugin-installer, unpacking, installing, etc...then you should be good to go
oh... actually more interesting, and possibly frustrating
what did it say after you typed the command?
it just says "flashplugin-installer is already the newest version"
this is definitely frustrating because I've already restarted Firefox and Ubuntu
so no flash apps work?
nothing so far
I suppose I should try something like on YouTube or something, but espn.com doesn't seem to want to show me anything
not all flash apps will work in the linux version unfortunately
try youtube though, because that definitely works
correct... it does... that's a little disappointing though
yes it is
perhaps I'll still be able to watch some goodness on hulu or something, and I'll have to use GASP Windows for ESPN.  Poo
yeah hulu works fine too
Well good deal... thanks for the help... I'm sure the intelligent minds behind ubuntu will get keep making this thing better
